intro: Sinapis taurica, commonly known as Tauric mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region and parts of southern Europe. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Sinapis taurica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
